definition: vitally important/a matter of life and death
nature/character/property/quality/attribute/sexuality/sex/gender/suffix forming adjective from verb/suffix forming noun from adjective, corresponding to -ness or -ity/essence/CL:個|个[ge4]
life/fate/order or command/to assign a name, title etc
mountain pass/to close/to shut/to turn off/to concern/to involve

sentences.english: You seem like a very nice girl. But it's a fact:In there life-threatening situations human being lie.
sentences.chinese: 你是個好女孩，但在性命攸關的情況下，人會撒謊的。

sentences.english: Knowing how to use this equipment properly can mean the difference between life and death.
sentences.chinese: 知道如何正確使用這些器材可能是性命攸關的大事。
